sen.e: The House of Nijo was provided with the postmortem name from the House of Ashikaga shogun and the House of Tokugawa shogun over generations and is considered as the number-one sympathizer of bakufu among the Five Sekke (Regent) Houses.

The Nijo Family was accorded a personal name by the Ashikaga Shogun Family and the Tokugawa Shogun Family over generations, and is considered to be the number-one sympathizer of bakufu among the five sekke (regent) houses.
sen.cmt: 「諱」ですが、posthumous nameではなく、personal nameではないでしょうか？（天皇でも同じ）"House of～" -> "～ Family" に変更しました。

sen.e: The House of Nijo was once schismatized in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), but it regained power under Yoshimoto NIJO who was on the Northern Court (Japan) side.

The Nijo Family was once schismatized during the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), but it regained power under Yoshimoto NIJO, who was on the Northern Dynasty (Japan) side.
sen.cmt: 「南北朝時代」の訳を修正。"House" -> "Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 特に明治以前の即位式において新天皇に灌頂を授ける「即位灌頂」の儀を掌る役目は室町時代以後二条家が独占していた。
sen.e: In particular, after the Muromachi period, the House of Nijo dominated the position that was in charge of the ceremony of "accessionto the throne" that was to offer kanjo, cabalistic ceremony provided to the emperor to be, to a new emperor at an enthronement ceremony before the Meiji period.

Particularly, after the Muromachi period the House of Nijo dominated the position that was in charge of the pre-Edo ceremony of "accession to the throne," which was to offer kanjo (cabalistic ceremony provided to the Emperor-to-be) to the new Emperor at an enthronement ceremony.

Particularly, after the Muromachi period until Meiji period, the Nijo Family dominated the position that was in charge of "Sokui kanjo (accession to the throne)," which was to offer kanjo (cabalistic ceremony provided to the Emperor-to-be) to the new Emperor at an enthronement ceremony.
sen.cmt: 文章のつながりを分かりやすく修正"House of～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代、当時の摂家最大の実力者とされていた近衛基熙が本来は摂関家全てに即位灌頂の礼式が伝わっている事、先代当主の二条光平の早世で礼式が絶えたことを理由に二条家の独占を継続すべきではないと唱えた。
sen.e: In the Edo period, Motohiro KONOE who was the most powerful among the Sekke House at that time argued that the House of Nijo should not continue the domination of the position of the accessionto the throne because code of etiquette of the accessionto the throne should originally come down to all the Sekke House and the previous family head, Mitsuhira NIJO, died young, whereby the code of etiquette did not come down to Motohiro KONOE.

During the Edo period, Motohiro KONOE, who was the most powerful among the sekke houses at that time, argued that the House of Nijo should not continue the dominant position in the accession to the throne because the code of etiquette for accession should originally come down to all the sekke houses and the previous family head, Mitsuhira NIJO, had died young, whereby the code of etiquette did not come down to Motohiro KONOE.

During the Edo period, Motohiro KONOE, who was at the time considered to be the most powerful among the sekke families, argued that the Nijo Family should not continue the dominant position in the accession to the throne out of the following two reasons: one being that the code of etiquette for accession should originally come down to all the sekke families, and the other being that the previous family head, Mitsuhira NIJO, had died young, and therefore the code of etiquette had terminated.
sen.cmt: who was considered as the most powerful among the sekke familiesとしました。 原文により近くなるように修正しました。"House" -> "Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: これに対して霊元上皇は他家にも伝わっているにも関わらず二条家の独占になっているのは相応の理由があるからであるとして、たとえ二条家当主が現職の摂関・大臣でなくても「即位灌頂」のみは二条家当主が行う事、もし当主が幼くして二条家を継いだ場合には儀式の秘法を知るもう一人の存在である当代の天皇が責任をもって当主に伝授する事を裁定して公式に二条家の独占となった。
sen.e: In reply to the argument, Reigen Joko (ex. Emperor) reasoned that there should have been a substantial reason why the position had been dominated by the House of Nijo in spite of the fact that the accession to the throne had come down to the other family, and juded that even if the family head of the House of Nijo was not the incumbent regent, chief adviser to the Emperor, or minisgter, only the "accessionto the throne" should be administered by the family head of the House of Nijo, and that in the case where the family head inherited the House of Nijo young, the Emperor, who was the other that knew mysicality of the ceremony shoud give instructions to the family head, which resulted in the official domination of the position by the House of Nijo.

In reply to the argument, Reigen Joko (the former Emperor) reasoned that there should have been a substantial reason why the position had been dominated by the House of Nijo despite the fact that the accession to the throne had come down to the other family, and judged that even if the family head of the House of Nijo was not the incumbent regent, chief adviser to the Emperor, or minister, only the "accession to the throne" should be administered by the family head of the House of Nijo, and that in the case where the family head inherited the House of Nijo while still young, the Emperor (who was the other that knew mysticism of the ceremony) should give instructions to the family head, which resulted in the official domination of the position by the House of Nijo.

In reply to the argument, the retired Emperor Reigen reasoned that there should have been a substantial reason why the position had been dominated by the Nijo Family despite the fact that the accession to the throne had come down to the other families, and judged that even if the head of the Nijo Family was not the incumbent regent, chief adviser to the Emperor or minister, only the 'Sokui kanjo' should be administered by the head of the Nijo Family, and that in the case where the family head inherited the Nijo Family while still young, the Emperor (who was the other that knew mysticism of the ceremony) should give instructions to the family head, all of which resulted in the official domination of the position by the Nijo Family.
sen.cmt: retired emperor Reigen としました。"House of～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代の屋敷跡地は、京都御苑の区画外に位置していたため、他の4家の摂政関白家とは異なり公園とはなってはおらず、同志社女子大学の構内となっている。
